docs.snippet: After more than two years awaiting trial in the United States on Enron-related charges, three British bankers pleaded guilty Wednesday in federal court to one count each of wire fraud....

docs.snippet: In the swirl of chicanery and self-dealing at Enron, little noticed was $3 million in fake consultation services at the company. But a former Enron human resources director, Christian Deeb Rahaim, recently pleaded guilty to the fraudulent activity...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the swirl of chicanery and self-dealing at Enron, little noticed was $3 million in fake consultation services at the company. But a former Enron human resources director, Christian Deeb Rahaim, recently pleaded guilty to the fraudulent activity. What Mr. Rahaim, of Mandeville, La., confessed to was not part of Enron's 2001 bankruptcy case, but a scheme where he billed the company for $1.2 million in bogus consultation services.
docs.abstract: Former Enron human resources director Christian Deeb Rahaim has pleaded guilty to receiving $1.2 million in fake consultation fees and transferring $1.8 million without authorization (S)

docs.snippet: To the Editor:     The rise and fall of Enron's emperors represent the triumph of public protest against the banality of avarice and the abuse of corporate power. It is not, however, the end of hubris....
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: The rise and fall of Enron's emperors represent the triumph of public protest against the banality of avarice and the abuse of corporate power. It is not, however, the end of hubris.
docs.abstract: Brij Mohan letter says rise and fall of Enron's executives represents triumph of public protest against abuse of corporate power (May 26 article)
